intro: Psychotria gossweileri, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers and dense, evergreen foliage. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Psychotria gossweileri is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and its role in ecological systems.
